qa_pairs.question: Why do you think San Francisco loses good teachers?
qa_pairs.answer: I think that they lose really good teachers because there's other places to live.
qa_pairs.source_text: but but definitely I think that they lose really good teachers because you know you know because theres theres other places to live

qa_pairs.question: Why are you helping your daughter buy a condo in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: We're helping her buy it mostly because she's expressed interest in staying but also because I've seen people move out of the city to follow their kids wherever they are, and I want to lock in that my daughter could be close to me.
qa_pairs.source_text: my daughter actually were going to close on a condo and um were helping her buy it mostly because shes expressed interest in staying but also because Ive seen um people move out of the city to follow their kids wherever they are because this is uh becomes a necessity I think when you get to an advanced age as you want to be close to your family so to lock in that my daughter could be close to me and that I dont have to chase her around the country or the world I helped her

qa_pairs.question: What is your view on housing for service workers in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I think that the service workers can only exist if they can have housing.
qa_pairs.source_text: but I think that the service workers can only exist if if they can have housing

qa_pairs.question: What are your thoughts on housing accessibility for public service workers?
qa_pairs.answer: I think if they help the policemen and firemen, they would get workers. I think also even the muni drivers because, you know, take public transportation.
qa_pairs.source_text: well I think I think actually if they if they help the policemen and firemen that they would think they would get Workers I think also even the muni drivers because you know take public transportation

qa_pairs.question: What do you think about the Richmond area in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I always think that in the Richmond near Clement is probably one of the nicest places to live because it's pretty flat and the weather's pretty good, so a person who didn't have a car could have access to just so much.
qa_pairs.source_text: it seems to me like everything on the west side is pretty good you know I think you know I because Ive thought about this that I always think that in the Richmond near Clement is would be prob probably one of the nicest place to places to live because its pretty flat and the weathers pretty good so a person who didnt have a car could have access to just so much

qa_pairs.question: Why did you choose a condo with an elevator for your daughter?
qa_pairs.answer: I chose a condo that has an elevator because my parents had issues with accessibility in their house, and I want to ensure my daughter has better access.
qa_pairs.source_text: whats interesting is Ive heard because um you know I I was looking at condos that had an elevator and I guess because my parents you know who just passed on there were two there were two issues about them staying in their house one was that their their bathroom was totally not accessible and there were these stairs so for my daughter I chose a condo that that has an elevator

qa_pairs.question: What amenities are available near your daughter's condo?
qa_pairs.answer: The condo is near two or three banks, a Safeway, two really good Chinese stores, a Chinese bakery, Walgreens, a pizza place, the library, and a public swimming pool.
qa_pairs.source_text: and actually Im going to convert one of the bathrooms into a walk-in shower now I think if you had those kind of condo condos that were like around you know you know and then its this is a condo thats you know the banks theres two two Banks uh or three Banks within a within a three block radius shes got three Banks shes got a safe way shes got two really good Chinese stores a Chinese Bakery Walgreens and um a pizza place and the library oh and three blocks away from a public swimming pool

qa_pairs.question: What is your perspective on community accessibility for the aging population?
qa_pairs.answer: I've been thinking about accessibility not just for wheelchair access but for the aging community. It's really important, especially after being a hands-on caregiver.
qa_pairs.source_text: and then thinking about that Ive been thinking about you know accessibility not just for you know wheelchair access but for for the Aging Community its really uh really something important I would say you know um having had like the last seven or eight years being a Hands-On caregiver

qa_pairs.question: What challenges do people face with park and recreation programs in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: It's such craziness trying to log in to get the programs. Maybe if they could expand on it to make it so that people can get those really inexpensive programs.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think um you know we we did a lot of the park and Iraq programs and like its kind of funny like I was giving my receptionist some advice about like logging in in March on the Saturday to get the programs that Im like okay make sure make sure you um have an account ready and youve got a couple of computers and even if you try and log in for 15 minutes dont give up and like its such craziness like maybe if they could expand on it to make it so that like people can get those really inexpensive programs

qa_pairs.question: What is your opinion on the BMR housing lottery system?
qa_pairs.answer: I heard that it's a really hard lottery system, but I have two patients that actually won the lottery, so I'm happy for them. Maybe if they were able to expand on that idea.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think the other thing is like um I guess um there is like theres BMR housing or and actually um I heard that its a really hard Lottery system like how can you like make it so like a lottery but you know what I have two patients that actually won the lottery so Im happy for them then I you know I just think wow theyre theyre just so lucky but um maybe if they were able to kind of expand on that that idea

qa_pairs.question: How do small businesses contribute to the sense of community in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: It's the small businesses where you have that sense of community. I grew up in such a white world that I don't speak Chinese well, but at one of the Chinese markets, the owner makes me speak Chinese every time I go in, and so I think it's very special.
qa_pairs.source_text: I guess small businesses and the sense of community or like seeing seeing the same people every day you know you know but but its the small businesses I mean you know I I grew up in such a white world that I dont speak Chinese well but at one of the Chinese markets the owners he makes me speak Chinese every time I go in hes kind of teaching me Chinese and so I dont know thats very special

qa_pairs.question: What makes San Francisco interesting compared to other places?
qa_pairs.answer: What makes San Francisco so interesting is the neighborhoods.
qa_pairs.source_text: and so I think its the small businesses where you have that sense of community I think thats also actually why I find San Franciscos so much more interesting than you know you could I guess you could live anywhere in anywhere in USA but what makes San Francisco so interesting is the neighborhoods

qa_pairs.question: What is your opinion on high-rise condominiums in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I think trying to make housing more affordable by putting up some really outrageous high-rise condominiums is kind of strange. It would be better to allow new housing that's contiguous with what's already there.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think one comment I would make like um I think trying to make um housing more affordable by putting up some really outrageous high-rise Condominiums is kind of like strange that projects like that even get considered like because I think that um if you are able to um allow new housing thats kind of like with kind of contiguous with whats already there its really be better than letting some develop or put up a big high rise

qa_pairs.question: What are your thoughts on the current state of San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Right now is a real down time. There seems to be a lack of law, a lawlessness that needs to be under control. If people don't feel safe, it's not a good thing.
qa_pairs.source_text: seeing the city kind of go through its ups and downs and I think that right now is a real down time um I I guess there seems to be a lack of law law there seems to be a lawlessness here that needs to be under control and if people dont feel like theyre very its very safe then um its not a good thing

qa_pairs.question: What role should the mayor play in improving San Francisco's economy?
qa_pairs.answer: The mayor has to be more of a deal maker as far as bringing in new business. There was a time when Tech wanted to be here, and I'm sure there's a way to attract maybe a different sector here.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think um also um that um I think actually at the top um this the the mayor has to be more of a deal maker as far as like bringing in new business you know because um you know there was a time when Tech wanted to be here and Im sure theres a way to attract maybe a different sector here
